text:
Hey folks! I'm on the hunt to find a Marketing mentor that can help guide me on my growth as a Marketer. As a startup marketer, I've worked most things out on my own, but I'm now looking for someone to provide both strategic and tactical advice, as well as just general career/personal growth advice to help me grow on my journey.

So I have a couple of asks...

1. Is any senior Marketing leader willing to either act as a mentor or be willing to refer me to someone who would be open to providing guidance?

2. Does anyone know any tools or programs that have worked for themselves or someone they know to connect mentors and mentees?

(FYI - I'm based out of Toronto, Ontario)

As a startup marketer, I've worked most things out on my own, but I'm now looking for someone to provide both strategic and tactical advice, as well as just general career/personal growth advice to help me grow on my journey.

So I have a couple of asks...

1. Is any senior Marketing leader willing to either act as a mentor or be willing to refer me to someone who would be open to providing guidance?

2. Does anyone know any tools or programs that have worked for themselves or someone they know to connect mentors and mentees?

(FYI - I'm based out of Toronto, Ontario)

text: Thank you everyone for your wise words! Appreciate it.

elements.text: Thank you everyone for your wise words! Appreciate it.

text:
:wave: Hi community, sharing a resource that hopefully will help with career development: outside of my full time marketing job, I run a leadership fellowship and group coaching program, *Ceiling Breakers*, *designed for people of color, women, immigrants, and LGBTQ+*. It’s a 3-month program where one goes deep in self discovery and mindset shifts with a vetted high caliber group of ~10 peers (prior participants came from Google, Facebook, Airbnb, Lyft, Figma, Miro, Slack, McKinsey, UCSF etc).

The groups are led by top notch executive coaches (former Head of D&I at McKinsey, and CHRO at venture-backed startup who was my previous exec coach at Slack) who typically coach execs with high fees. Three of us (all POC women) started this because there’s a lack of access to high quality exec coaching for middle and senior career folks and we want to see more BIPOC, women, immigrant and LGBTQ people grow to exec roles (and a few of our past participants actually did!).

There are still a few seats left for the Spring cohort that’s kicking off in a few weeks, if you or someone on your team (5-15 years experience, manager+) might benefit, learn more at <http://www.ceilingbreakers.us|www.ceilingbreakers.us>, or feel free to DM me for more questions.

text: Hi <@U035JHVUZ0F>! I have bumped into growth mentor's ads a few times though I have never tried their services. Could this be what you are looking for? <https://www.growthmentor.com/>
